page.title: 20RONALD BAKER_working miner.
page.content: Mr Baker has been chosen as a representative figure in the community.He is typical of the kind of service many valley people given to the community. Mr Baker left school at the age of fourteen and began work in a level with his father.He worked at several local levels and Cwmtillery Pit until he became Safety Officer at Abertillery New Mine.To become a safety officer he studied for his deputies certificate and gained this in 1955. In the mines he began as a road repairer,then became a deputy shotfirer and training supervisor before his final job as safety officer.A job he held for twenty years. Mr Baker retired from work in 1975.
